p: Phytolacca americana (common name pokeweed, Phytolaccaceae) is a big branched herb (up to 3 m) sometimes lignified at the base. It was introduced for medicinal purposes and for use in dyeing. It exists in disturbed and ruderal habitats, agricultural fields and along the sides of roads. It is native to North America [ 9]. It is also invasive in Europe and Western USA [ 18].
